events.description:
NEW DATE! This event scheduled for April 28, 2020 is rescheduled to August 8, 2020. All tickets for April 28, 2020 will be honored on August 8, 2020, and all ticket holders will receive an email with more information and instructions on how to receive a refund if needed. Thanks for your flexibility!

********
Crows are everywhere: they are found on nearly every continent and thrive in human dominated environments. They have influenced art and literature throughout history, and whether they inspire love or hate, they have certainly impacted the hearts and minds of the humans who share their space. Because crows are so common, it may be easy to overlook the fact that they are very intelligent and have complex behaviors and social structures, including play, tool use, communal roosting, and being able to recognize specific humans.

Kaeli Swift, PhD, studies crows and other corvids (ravens, jays, and magpies), and will introduce and explain to us the world of these fascinating birds, including, of course, crow funerals. You can find Dr. Swift on Twitter and Instagram @corvidresearch where she talks about crows, corvids, and other wildlife and plays a weekly game called #CrowOrNo to help people learn how to correctly ID and distinguish different kinds of corvids.

Note: This is a repeat of several sold-out shows on this topic, and this one could sell out too. Get your tickets early!

***EVENT DETAILS***

NEW DATE: Saturday, August 8, 2020

TIME: Doors at 6:00 p.m. event at 7:00 p.m.

LOCATION: Aladdin Theater, 3017 SE Milwaukie Ave, Portland, OR

ADVANCE TICKETS*:
- General Admission: $19
- Student / Senior (65+): $10
- VIP** (guaranteed seating): $25
- Supporter**: $39

TICKETS AT DOOR:

FOOD & DRINK: Beer, wine, & sodas, as well as pizza and snacks like candy bars and mixed nuts.

https://viaproductions.org/events/aladdin_april_28_crows/

Note: There will be ASL interpretation at this event.

_____

We at Science on Tap are committed to offering educational opportunities to adults who want to learn. If the ticket price is a hardship for you, please write to us at info@viaproductions.org and weâ€™re happy to provide reduced-price tickets to those who request them.

*A note on advance ticket sales: There is an additional fee for purchase, but this ticket guarantees a seat at the event start time of 7:00pm.

Supporter tickets get VIP benefits (guaranteed seating) plus a voluntary upcharge to help support the true cost of producing events.

events.title: Exploring the Health of Our Modern Food System
events.description:
Join us on Wednesday, August 5, from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. PST / 2:00 to 4:00 p.m. EST for Farm Sanctuary’s virtual social justice program event: Exploring the Health of Our Modern Food System.

Join Farm Sanctuary’s CEO and Executive Director Megan Watkins and Farm Sanctuary’s Manager of Social Justice Programs Kamekǝ Brown as they sit down with four guest experts to explore conditions within our food system and how the current pandemic is exposing their impact on animals, workers, communities, and the planet.

Together, we'll learn about timely issues within our food system and consider possibilities for collaboration and solidarity in the service of a more just and compassionate world.

Presentations by:

Amanda Hitt, Director of Government Accountability Project’s Food Integrity Campaign

Sindy Benavides, CEO of League of United Latin American Citizens

Larry Baldwin, Crystal Coast Waterkeeper

Gerardo Reyes Chávez, Leader from the Coalition of Immokalee Workers

events.title: Washington: Take Action Now for Orcas!
events.description:
The Trump administration and the US Dept of Army Corps are continuing to attack states’ efforts to protect clean water and sustainable fisheries.

The federal government’s own studies show that the large, shallow reservoirs on the Lower Snake and Columbia rivers soak up the sun’s energy and make the water too hot for endangered salmon and steelhead. Southern Resident orcas are on the brink of extinction, partly because they cannot find enough Chinook salmon to eat. Despite these declines, salmon biologists also view the Snake River basin as among the best Chinook salmon restoration opportunities anywhere on the West Coast. Rather than taking steps to reduce the dams’ temperature pollution, the Trump administration’s Army Corps appealed the temperature limits imposed by Washington regulators to the Washington Pollution Control Hearings Board.

We must put pressure on our elected officials to restore cold, clean water that supports strong salmon and orca populations for generations to come. But recovering salmon and orcas requires action in Congress, too. Tell Senators Murray and Cantwell, and the EPA, to develop a regional solution—including Lower Snake River dam removal—that protects salmon, Southern Resident orcas, and our communities.

Office of Senator Patty Murray
https://www.murray.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/contactme

Office Of Senator Maria Cantwell (Washington)
https://www.cantwell.senate.gov/contact/email/form

Please take action today and tell Northwest elected leaders to develop inclusive solutions to keep the rivers cool, protect salmon, and reinvest in river communities.

** Sample letter **

"I'm writing to ask for your leadership to reduce water temperatures in the Snake and Columbia River to protect and restore endangered salmon, the Southern Resident orcas, and the communities who depend on them.

Specifically, I request that you consider the following points:
* The Lower Snake and Columbia rivers are too hot for endangered salmon and steelhead. The Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) study recently released by EPA clearly shows that the dams are the main cause of increased water temperatures.

* Large, shallow reservoirs created by the dams—coupled with intensifying climate change—threaten the Columbia and Snake rivers’ already-imperiled salmon and steelhead.

* The science is clear—restoring the Lower Snake River is our very best opportunity to restore imperiled salmon and orca populations.

* I urge you to work with the people and policymakers in the Northwest to develop a comprehensive package of measures that restores the Lower Snake River and its salmon, helps feed starving Southern Resident orca, and invests in clean energy that protects the health of our communities and our river.

*Northwest communities and leaders must work together to craft a bold and effective plan that achieves these goals as quickly as possible. Without effective leadership, we risk losing these iconic species and the special benefits they bring to our region.

Thank you again for your careful consideration of this request."

events.title: Speak up for WA Wolves at the Wolf Advisory Group
events.description:
Please speak up for Washington's wolves!

The Washington Department of Fish & Wildlife director Kelly Susewind authorized WDFW staff to lethally remove a wolf from the Wedge pack territory in response to depredations on livestock in prime wolf habitat. WDFW has killed 31 wolves since 2012, 26 of those for the same livestock operator in the Kettle River Range in northeast Washington.

“The Department of Fish and Wildlife wrongly thinks it can shoot its way into coexistence with wolves,” said Amaroq Weiss, West Coast wolf advocate at the Center for Biological Diversity. “The department’s relentless wolf-killing in northeast Washington shows exactly why the state needs new, enforceable rules for handling livestock-wolf issues, especially in areas of chronic conflict.”

Here are 3 Ways to Take Action:

1) Contact WDFW Director Kelly Susewind
360-902-2200
Kelly.Susewind@dfw.wa.gov, director@dfw.wa.gov

Contact Kelly's boss, the WA Fish and Wildlife Commission 360-902-2267
commission@dfw.wa.gov
https://wdfw.wa.gov/about/commission/contact

2) Contact Governor Jay Inslee. He has the authority to reign in The Department: https://www.governor.wa.gov/contact/contact/send-gov-inslee-e-message

3) The next Washington Wolf Advisory Group (WAG) meeting is scheduled for Wednesday, August 5 and Thursday, August 6 starting at 9 a.m. each day. A meeting agenda will be posted to the Wolf Advisory Group page when available here: https://wdfw.wa.gov/about/advisory/wag#meeting-calendar

The WAG work session will be open to the public to observe and will follow the same format used previously, including public comment opportunities at the end of each day. Please

events.title: The End of Meat Film Screening and Raffle - Free
events.description:
We apologize but this event has reached capacity and sign-ups are now closed. Please join us for our next virtual event!



The End of Meat is a groundbreaking documentary film envisioning a future where meat consumption belongs to the past. Filmmaker Marc Pierschel embarks on a journey to discover what effect a post-meat world would have on the environment, the animals, and ourselves. He meets Esther the Wonder Pig, who became an internet phenomenon; talks to pioneers leading the vegan movement in Germany; visits the first fully vegetarian city in India; witnesses rescued farm animals enjoying their newfound freedom; observes the future food innovators making meat and cheese without the animals, even harvesting “bacon” from the ocean; and much more.

This event is sponsored in part by VegFund♥

events.title: Beaver Believers Film-Screening Fundraiser for Speak for Wolves
events.description:
Join us for a virtual screening of the award-winning feature documentary "The Beaver Believers" hosted by filmmaker Sarah Koenigsberg, to benefit "Speak for Wolves." Q&A to follow.

Sometimes the best solutions to the biggest problems can be found in the most unexpected places. Meet the beaver believers: five scientists and a sassy, spicy hairdresser, taking a bite out of climate change, one stick at a time.

The Beaver Believers is the urgent yet whimsical story of an unlikely cadre of activists who share a common vision: restoring the North American Beaver, that most industrious, ingenious, bucktoothed engineer, to the watersheds of the arid West. The Beaver Believers encourage us to embrace a new paradigm for managing our western lands, one that seeks to partner with the natural world rather than overpower it. As a keystone species, beaver enrich their ecosystems, creating the complexity and resiliency our watersheds need to absorb the impacts of climate change. Beavers can show us the way and even do much of the work for us, if only we can find the humility to trust in the restorative power of nature and our own ability to play a positive role within it.

A favorite on the 2019 Banff Mountain Film Festival World Tour, winner of the Green Spark Award at the American Conservation Film Festival, winner of the Eco-Hero Award at the Portland Eco-Film Festival, and a finalist at both the London Eco-Film Festival and the Vancouver International Mountain Film Festival, this film will inspire you to think differently about climate change.

Proceeds go to Speak for Wolves. Speak for Wolves is a small, volunteer-run 501(c)3 nonprofit organization advocating for wolf and wildlife conservation. Their primary activity is to gather wildlife conservation experts together each year for an educational conference that is free to attendees, with a goal to inspire and engage grassroots activists to advocate for wildlife management reform in the U.S. www.speakforwolves.org
events.hosts: Speak for Wolves and The Beaver Believers

events.title: Green Team: The Sixth Mass Extinction And How To Stop It
events.description:
Join with this link: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/177436308

We are in a planetary emergency. Exasterabated by our climate crisis, we are heading into the Sixth Mass Extinction where close to 1 million animal and plant species are facing extinction but there's hope! Wayne Hsiung discusses how we got here, and what every city can do to stop extinction that affects all life on this Earth and how YOU are instrumental in preventing it.

Wayne Hsiung -- who is running for Mayor of Berkeley -- hosts virtual hangouts with the #GreenTeam: a grassroots campaign of volunteers working to transform Berkeley into the first truly green city in the world. Get the latest campaign news, develop your voter outreach skills, and make a better Berkeley for the future.

SIGN UP to volunteer with us at wayneformayor.com/volunteer.

events.title: Sanctuary Weekend
events.description:
Join us for our free virtual Sanctuary Weekend event featuring both of our Sanctuaries—no plane tickets required.

Imagine: It’s a warm summer’s day at our Southern California Sanctuary, and you’re lounging in the sand with a pack of sleepy rescued pigs. In the time it takes you to stand up and kick the mud off of your boots, you’re suddenly transported to the spacious pastures of our New York Sanctuary, where you find yourself surrounded by curious goats and friendly sheep eager for your attention.

This doesn’t have to be a daydream.

Formerly known as the “Hoedown,” Sanctuary Weekend is a beloved annual event typically held at our flagship New York Sanctuary. This year, for everyone’s safety, we won’t be convening in person—but that won’t hold us back from coming together as a community. And it gives us the opportunity to visit both Sanctuaries.

As always, our rescued residents remain the heart of Sanctuary Weekend. Our lifesaving work—and the healing space that you help us provide—are essential, especially now. Our knowledgeable shelter team will share recaps of this year’s notable rescues, and take you around each Sanctuary to meet the animals.

We’ll also be creating space for the big ideas you’ve come to expect at Sanctuary Weekend, with a special panel discussion on community building featuring guest speakers. Plus, our leadership team will detail our mission and the work we’re doing to create Sanctuary for all.

We hope you’ll join us August 22-23 for an inspiring weekend rooted in compassion.

events.title: Call Governor Brown: Aug 25th! OR Mega-dairy Moratorium Now!
events.description:
On Tuesday August 25th, we're making phone calls to Governor Brown to enact an immediate mega-dairy moratorium to protect Oregon’s air, water, climate, small farmers and rural communities.

CALL: 1-866-961-3208 on TUESDAY AUGUST 25th!

Oregon is in the midst of a mega-dairy crisis. Weak rules and ineffective state leadership has allowed industrial mega-dairies to push family farmers off the land, pollute our air and water, and threaten the health of local communities.

Mega-dairies don’t belong in Oregon, yet, state officials and Governor Brown are letting mega-polluting mega-dairies set up shop in Oregon’s primarily Latino and Indigenous rural communities. We don’t want our state to become the next hotbed for mega-dairies polluting our air and water and harming our health and climate.

It’s time to hold our state leaders accountable. Governor Brown wants to be a climate champion but she refuses to address the threat caused by mega-dairies. Call Governor Brown today! Protect Oregon - enact a mega-dairy moratorium!

CALL: 1-866-961-3208 on TUESDAY AUGUST 25th!

events.title: Using Local Legislation to Protect Animals: Fur Bans
events.description: Learn how to fight back against the cruel fur industry by passing a fur ban in your community! Animals farmed for their fur endure horrific abuse before being killed through gassing, electrocution, neck-breaking, and poisoning. Led by Animal Legal Defense Fund Campaigns Manager Elizabeth Holtz, this webinar will walk you through the mechanics of fur production, the policy issues, including animal cruelty, environmental impacts, and public health, as well as a round-up of existing international, state, and local laws prohibiting the sale of fur. While the webinar will touch on the elements of local legislative campaigns, please refer to earlier webinars (available at aldf.org/circusban and aldf.org/retailban) for an in-depth look at grassroots campaigning.

events.title: Meetup: How we will Place a Moratorium on Murder
events.description:
DxE is calling for a statewide moratorium on slaughterhouses and factory farms. But what exactly is a moratorium and how can it lead to ending animal exploitation? Come to the Meetup to hear about the history of moratoriums and how other states have already used moratoriums to impact animal agriculture.

Message us for the Zoom link!

Shelter-in-place won't stop us from being together as a community! We have weekly Meetups because it's extremely valuable for us regularly interact, even if we can't do so in person. Connecting with fellow activists strengthens out friendships, animal rights community, and the entire movement, which makes us better able to fight for animal liberation! The more we know and trust one another, the more resistant our community is to infiltration and in-fighting. It's also important for our own personal mental health to feel connected and support during these hard times.

Every Saturday at 11am we have Meetups for everyone and anyone who cares about animals and making the world a better place! 🌍🐮🐷🐔🐭🦊🐠

events.title: Online Day of Action To Stop Killing Wolves in Washington
events.description:
Terrible news out of Washington: The two remaining wolves of the Wedge pack, an adult female and an adult male, were killed by the state last week, finishing off the pack completely. Now, up to two wolves from the Leadpoint pack in Stevens County remain in danger of being killed.

Since 2012 the state has killed 34 wolves. Nearly all were slaughtered for conflicts on public lands, with 29 killed for the same livestock owner. The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife, catering to livestock operators, is out for blood. Washington's killing of wolves is barbaric and cruel, and must be stopped.

Multiple wolf conservation organizations are calling for the WDFW to immediately halt its ruthless killing of wolves to appease private ranching interests, and calling on Governor Inslee to reform wolf management in the state.

Please join our Day of Action Protest on Monday, August 24th to demand an end to the killing!

Next Monday, we ask you to:

1) Contact WDFW Director Kelly Susewind
360-902-2200
Kelly.Susewind@dfw.wa.gov, director@dfw.wa.gov

2) Contact Kelly's boss, the WA Fish and Wildlife Commission 360-902-2267
commission@dfw.wa.gov
https://wdfw.wa.gov/about/commission/contact

3) Contact Governor Jay Inslee. He has the authority to reign in the Department: https://www.governor.wa.gov/contact/contact/send-gov-inslee-e-message

Read this letter to Governor Inslee submitted by 18 conservation organizations last week:

https://www.biologicaldiversity.org/campaigns/wolves_on_the_west_coast/pdfs/Inslee-Letter_Wolf-Advisory-Group.pdf

You’re invited to join us for part one of our three-part webinar series: Shutting Down the Puppy Mill Pipeline. On Tuesday, September 1, at 12:30 PM, join Voters For Animal Rights (VFAR), American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ASPCA), The Humane Society of the United States (HSUS), the New York State Animal Protection Federation (The Fed), Companion Animal Protection Society (CAPS) and the Animal Legal Defense Fund (ALDF) to learn about the New York Puppy Mill Pipeline Bill, including its current status, and talk about how you can help pass this bill pass into law.

events.title: Run For Regan
events.description:
WHAT: Run For Regan

>> CLICK ON THIS LINK to sign up (You will be asked to provide your name/pseudonym, location, and planned running/walking/biking distance): https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSepbrs9hvQdkj0IxbNkfUMJZ8hqAADqhOuQZOATPQYPRNItyw/viewform

KM SUBMISSIONS/MODIFICATIONS: If you already submitted your kms and need to make a modification, please send a private message either to Melanie Martina, Karen Leeson Upshaw, or Amy Cleroux. If you already submitted your kms via private message, please do not submit them again through the link.

* * *

WHY: Every day at Fearmans slaughterhouse in Burlington, Ontario, 10,000 pigs are sentenced to a horrific death. Before they enter this facility and have their lives needlessly taken from them, some of these individuals experience - for the first time in their lives - a brief moment of compassion from activists who stop the trucks to bear witness to these unseen victims. On June 19th, 2020, a mere two days after ag-gag Bill 156 was passed through the Ontario Legislature, one of these activists - fierce animal rights champion Regan Russell - was violently run over and killed by a truck transporting pigs to Fearmans. The driver of the truck - who appears to have been emboldened by the passing of Bill 156 - has escaped criminal charges, and the Halton Police did not release the name of the truck driver, or the video of the incident.

* * *

WHEN: On Saturday September 19 - on the 3 month anniversary of her tragic death - let us honor Regan’s life as well as the lives of the 10,000 pigs who are are killed each day at Fearmans slaughterhouse.

* * *

WHERE: Everywhere!

* * *

HOW: Together, we will collectively run, walk, and bike 10,000 kms or more.

* * *

WHO: Everyone is encouraged to participate in any capacity and distance in their respective cities. **Please mark yourselves as "GOING" if you plan to participate and click on the link at the top of the page to let us know how many kms you plan to run/walk/bike. And please SHARE SHARE SHARE this event with as many people as possible!

* * *

ABOUT THE ORGANIZER:

Hello, my name is Orlando. I am a husband, father, mason, and running enthusiast. I recently completed my goal of running every single street in Barrie, ON to raise awareness about veganism and the benefits of an animal-free diet and lifestyle. I have participated in several road races, obstacle races, duathlons, as well as fundraising events such as The Ride To Conquer Cancer. My longest running distance to date is a Marathon, and on September 19, 2020, my goal is to surpass that distance by running 50 kms to honor Regan’s memory. I hope that others from across the globe will join me in achieving a collective 10,000 kms (or more!) to honor Regan as well as the 10,000 pigs who are senselessly slaughtered each day at Fearmans.

Follow us on Instagram: https://instagram.com/run4regan?igshid=1sbq1zrf1w03a

#Run4Regan #JusticeForReganRussell #GoVegan4Regan #SavePigs4Regan #StopBill156 #RepealBill156

Demand a Coroner’s Inquest: https://www.change.org/p/regional-supervising-coroner-demand-a-coroner-s-inquest-in-the-death-of-activist-regan-russell?recruiter=65282734&utm_source=share_petition&utm_medium=facebook&utm_campaign=psf_combo_share_initial&utm_term=petition_dashboard&recruited_by_id=92b5c723-cb17-4d31-b563-f75554925307&utm_content=fht-23450758-en-ca%3A3

Petition - Stop Bill 156: https://www.change.org/p/doug-ford-stop-bill-156-ontario-s-ag-gag-law?fbclid=IwAR1_2bNHpyxvKXomJmL3siOFNNTOwGEnj5qsNJYqRPQajfCbHkHokec3R3w

Petition - Repeal Ag Gag Laws & Protect Farmed Animals: https://e-activist.com/page/63205/petition/1?ea.tracking.id=facebook&fbclid=IwAR1qSMVKToOpAnsrIvW6vakPpdxPX2NvHwnR8ZC5NY6BREySaMfbSD1JMvI

events.title: White Meat with Christopher Sebastian
events.description:
Join us for a webinar from Christopher Sebastian entitled 'White Meat' which will talk about how the alt right has weaponized the exploitation of animals and turned it into a symbol of nationalism and white identity.

Eating and exploiting animals is a crucial aspect of defining white national identity. Those who strongly identify with white nationalist ideology view the consumption of animal bodies as an act of solidarity. At the end of the day, the question for me is not, “Why is animal exploitation a matter of white national identity?” To the animals who exist as mere products in the food chain, it doesn’t matter. For me, the question is, “Why do more people not forego animal exploitation as a matter of political resistance?"

Register here to join this fascinating discussion:
https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZ0ocOqgpj0pH9CL-S-GVTneIeyMkVVxbTUR

Event takes place on Sunday, September 27th at 10am PDT.

To learn more about Christopher Sebastian's work, please see
https://www.christophersebastian.info/lectures

events.title: Intersectional Veganism: A conversation about plant-based wellness and community health
events.description:
In the first of our webinar series on Intersectional Veganism we are honored to welcome special guest Tina Archuleta, Owner and Founder of Itality Plant-Based Wellness, to share some of her expertise and experiences. We will discuss plant-based wellness and learn about how Tina has been actively promoting healthy eating and reclamation of wellness in her community in Jemez Pueblo, New Mexico.

This Intersectional Veganism Webinar Series aims to explore some of the ways that being vegan helps support other forms of activism, and why it is important for animal rights activists to actively support other social justice movements.

Tina Archuleta is a tribal member of the Jemez Nation. She is a Natural Therapeutic Specialist (NTS), Licensed massage therapist (LMT), and Doula in training. Her love for natural remedies and wellness has been the guiding force of her life’s work. For the past 12 years Tina has been actively promoting healthy eating and reclamation of wellness in her community. She is the owner and founder of Itality: Plant Based Wellness. Where her company’s mission is to cultivate wellness in Native communities with locally sourced, organic, plant based food.

events.description: Author of Heart of a Lion, Rat Island, Where the Wild Things Were and most recently Towpath’s Tail - Stolzenburg tells us he writes about animals, for three reasons: “Because I find them wondrous, and good for the soul. Because it haunts me to know how badly we treat so many of them. And because they deserve every voice, every compassionate ally we can muster on their behalf.” Join us for this lively and informative discussion. There will be a limited live Q&A afterwards. events.title: Online Assembly: When Black Power Meets Animal Rights
events.description:
Did you know that in Pennsylvania in the 1970s, a collective called MOVE formed whose mission was to organize for black power and animal rights? Black history is animal rights history.

Join us on September 12th as we hear from Mike Africa Jr., member of The MOVE Organization who was born in prison to parents who were political prisoners. Mike will share his story and how he maintains a “never give up” attitude.

Mike was born in prison after his parents were arrested and sentenced to 100 years in prison. A week later, he was separated from them and placed into an abusive orphanage. Years later, his family was bombed by Philadelphia police and eleven of his family members were killed. Mike, at the age of 13, dedicated his life to bringing his parents home from prison and finally, when he was 40, they were paroled and reunited.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Register at liberationconference.com

Information to join the Zoom call will be emailed to those who register.

----------------------------------------------------------------

The Animal Liberation Online Assembly is an ongoing virtual gathering of animal rights activists. During a time of physical distancing, stay connected and find community. Be part of a movement that is bringing people together from around the world, to achieve revolutionary social and political change for animals.
The Online Assembly is the second Saturday of each month at 11am PDT (2pm EDT). Connect with activists from around the world, learn from leaders in social justice, and be part of a community for change. You can join at any time and you don’t need to make it to every one - come when you can!
Together, we will put liberation into action with our own hearts, minds, and hands.
All are welcome, including those new to activism and veganism.

Email info@liberationconference.com for further questions or accessibility requests. ASL interpretation is available but please email us to coordinate.

Online events are subject to our code of conduct - visit dxe.io/conduct to learn more.

We will discuss the consequences for global human and animal health and wellbeing, including: What role does industrial animal agriculture play? How can we prevent the future development of zoonoses that may turn into epi- and pandemics?

Moderator: Jan Dutkiewicz (Harvard Law School)

Speakers: Michael Greger (NutritionFacts.org), Mia MacDonald (Brighter Green), Astra Taylor (Documentary filmmaker and writer)

Gillian Meghan Walters, creator of MummyMOO project


and Brittany Michelson, author/ editor of the anthology


Connect with activists from different backgrounds as they reveal their perspectives on animal rights, their experiences taking action for animals, the challenges they've faced, and the meaning of activism in their lives.

*You can also tune in on Brittany Michelson's Facebook page and JaneUnchained


"Find out why respect for other living beings is the key to human survival in the face of senseless violence and climate change." - Jane Velez-Mitchell, founder of JaneUnchained News


"Inspirational testimonies illustrate that animal rights is a growing worldwide social justice movement" - Jenny McQueen, cofounder of Animal Rights Toronto


"Voices for Animal Liberation should be read by all of us striving to be better human beings." - Caroline Paul, author and activist

events.title: Veganizer PDX: DesiPDX Indian Feast (takeout)
events.description:
After a brief hiatus due to the coronavirus outbreak, Veganizer PDX is excited to team up with Desi PDX for an #officiallyveganized popup!

DesiPDX has always been gluten-free and vegan-friendly. The menu features seasonal produce sourced from local farms. Ingredients are organic whenever possible. We will be donating 15% of ticket sales to Black Futures Farm, a local community farm that is part of the Black Food Sovereignty Coalition program.

TICKETS: tinyurl.com/veganizer-desipdx

Your $65 ticket includes the following menu. It's a feast for one person, enough for two people. This event is takeout only. Select your preferred time slot for pickup at DesiPDX (4233 N Mississippi Ave); we offer 15-minute windows between 5pm and 8pm. Spots are limited, so we can accommodate social distancing. Please wear a mask.

-----------------

MENU
100% vegan, gluten-free, soy-free, nut-free

Seasonal Greens, Roasted and Pickled Seasonal Veggies, Charred Peach Chutney Dressing

Desi "Ratatouille" - Eggplant, Zucchini, and Tomato Curry

Grilled Mushrooms, Twice Cooked Potatoes, Coconut Milk Tandoori Sauce

Black Lentils, Kale, Coconut Ghee Beets

Basmati Rice, Lovage, Fennel

Coconut Milk, Turmeric, and Black Pepper Fudge

Menu subject to change based on availability of ingredients

TICKETS: tinyurl.com/veganizer-desipdx

-----------------

DESIPDX
DesiPDX is a food cart located on Portland’s bustling N. Mississippi Avenue serving food inspired by Indian spices and flavors that are blended with cooking styles from the West and other parts of the world, bringing a modern take to classic Indian recipes. The name of the cart is a play on the word Desi as the food uses locally and regionally sourced organic ingredients and expands on the idea of what “authentic” Indian food can be in a globalized world.

CHEF DEEPAK SAXENA was raised on traditional Indian food by his mother and father and found his own love for cooking in his early 20’s. In 2015, after 20 years as a software developer he decided to follow his 10 year dream of turning his love for food into his livelihood and opened DesiPDX in 2015. His prior career provided him many opportunities to travel the world and experience a variety of cooking styles and flavors.

Eric Schlosser’s seminal work, Fast Food Nation, set him on a course of changing his eating habits and also cooking more sustainably. This path also inspired him to be an advocate for healthy living and eating, and become involved in food policy and food politics. At DesiPDX, you will find these healthy and sustainable ideals literally cooked into the delicious fare.

DesiPDX is in ever evolving exploration in Indian Fusion fare incorporating traditional roots, many international influences, and Deepak’s own culinary whims. You will always discover new experiments on the menu whether it’s the weekly dhal, a seasonal garnish, or unique ingredients, spices, or flavor combinations. Deepak is committed to making sure everyone can indulge at DesiPDX with a Gluten-Free and Paleo/Vegan-Friendly menu and an intention to source locally and organically as much as possible.

His ingredient selections for organic and local are based on research on health, sustainability, and risk as well as cost.

VEGANIZER
Veganizer is a food consulting agency that collaborates with omnivore restaurants to host #officiallyveganized events and expand their vegan offerings, while bridging the gap between omnivore establishment and the vegan customer. Led by vegan blogger Waz Wu, the Portland chapter has quickly gained momentum since its launch in early 2017 and partnered with MF Tasty, Doug Fir Lounge, Red Sauce Pizza, Quaintrelle, Gumba, and many more. Veganizer PDX has been featured on KGW News, Eater PDX, Willamette Week, and local podcasts.

events.title: Sanctuary Speaker Series: Dr. A. Breeze Harper
events.description:
Join Farm Sanctuary for our virtual Sanctuary Speaker Series: inspiring discussions with the change-makers and thought leaders whose ideas and actions move our mission forward.

Our inaugural Sanctuary Speaker Series event will explore Antiracist Vegan Praxis, featuring an interview with Dr. A. Breeze Harper by Farm Sanctuary’s Manager of Social Justice Programs Miko Brown.

In this conversation, Dr. Harper shares her depth of experience working with groups to assess and implement antiracist practices at the organizational level and, more broadly, offers insight into dismantling racism in the food system—an interrelated web of oppression. This is a great watch for vegan advocates interested in finding out more about how their activism intersects with other social justice movements.

Participation in the event is free and completely virtual. All content can be accessed from a computer, tablet, or smartphone. Sign up for our email list we'll alert you when the video is live: http://bit.ly/SanctuarySpeakerSignup

SPEAKER BIO:

Dr. A. Breeze Harper is an antiracism and D&I strategic consultant and trainer. She is known as the creator and editor of Sistah Vegan: Black Female Vegans Speak on Food, Identity, Health and Society (Lantern Books 2010) and the author of the novel Scars: A Black Lesbian Experience in Rural White New England. Dr. Harper uses applications of antiracism, racial equity, and black feminisms to explore how racial caste, gender, and capitalism impact and influence ethical consumption philosophies with a white settler nation (USA). Her company Critical Diversity Solutions is a niche D&I boutique consultancy that uses antiracism, intersectionality, and racial justice to help clients become more inclusive and equitable. She has a PhD from University of California Davis, MA from Harvard University, and BA from Dartmouth College.

ABOUT OUR SANCTUARY SPEAKER SERIES:

Our modern industrialized food system is at the core of some of the most pressing issues of our time: Animal cruelty on an unimaginable scale. Environmental destruction. Human rights violations. Community devastation. Public health crises. To make substantive change, we need to work fast and pursue bold solutions—together.

Through one-on-one discussions with advocates, academics, environmentalists, entrepreneurs, and more, we’ll highlight the diverse strategies that fuel our shared goal of a more just and compassionate world.

events.title: Act for Wolves: WDFW invites public input on grazing on public lands
events.description:
The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife (WDFW) is inviting the public to submit written comments on how it proposes to manage livestock grazing on its lands. This is a huge opportunity to speak for wolves in Washington, as wolves number 1 threat is livestock being released in prime wolf habitat!

WDFW is conducting an environmental review on the proposed changes in accordance with the State Environmental Policy Act (SEPA). Members of the public who would like to provide input on the substance of the grazing program guidance and management tools can do that through an online survey through Sept. 24, 2020 (https://wdfw.wa.gov/licenses/environmental/sepa/open-comments).

The public is also invited to provide feedback on the proposed regulations to implement the grazing guidance either through an online survey https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/DFWGRAZING20 or by emailing comments to rules.coordinator@dfw.wa.gov. WDFW must receive comments by 5 p.m. Sept. 24.

The Fish and Wildlife Commission will host a public hearing for the grazing rule update at their Oct. 22-24, 2020 meeting.
events.hosts: NARN ( Northwest Animal Rights Network ) and Speak for Wolves

events.title: Understanding Bird Behavior: A Guide to What Birds Do & Why
events.description:
Birds are intelligent, sociable creatures that exhibit a wide array of behaviors—from mobbing and mimicking to mating and joint nesting. They have creative foraging techniques, including tool usage and thievery. Their courtship rituals to woo and win mates can be elaborate, and while they can show cooperation, there can also be familial conflicts that crop up among parents, offspring, and siblings.

In this special avian Science on Tap, biologist and author Dr. Wenfei Tong http://darwinsjackal.blogspot.com will describe scientific research and fascinating vignettes about the private lives of birds, from finding food and family life, to coping with climate and other threats. Drawing from her two books:
"Understanding Bird Behavior: An Illustrated Guide to What Birds Do and Why" https://press.princeton.edu/books/ebook/9780691211817/understanding-bird-behavior
"Bird Love: The Family Life of Birds" https://press.princeton.edu/books/ebook/9780691208909/bird-love
she will share detailed images of all kinds of bird behavior. Also, learn how you as a citizen scientist can help add to what we know about birds in your part of the world.

Buy the book directly from Princeton Press, use coupon code SCITAP, and get 40% off!
https://press.princeton.edu/books/hardcover/9780691206004/understanding-bird-behavior

Use Coupon Code: SCITAP
Offer good until October 1, 2020.

*****
Written questions during the event are welcome.

Visit our Facebook page at 7pm on Thursday for the Facebook live show (refresh until you see the video post), or watch the high quality version on Zoom: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUzWzKucQtOEV7kxx6xVag

events.title: Portland: Protest ExxonMobil’s Sponsorship of the Cruel and Deadly Iditarod Dog Race!
events.description:
Please join PETA and local activists at a socially distant protest of ExxonMobil’s sponsorship of the deadly Iditarod dog race. Over 150 dogs have died in this cruel race, and in just the last decade, dogs forced to run in the Iditarod have died from heart attacks, internal bleeding, inhaling their own vomit, and being buried alive in snow. This protest is part of the launch of PETA’s campaign against ExxonMobil’s complicity in this cruelty as one of the race’s last major sponsors. The dogs need all of our voices to stand up against their suffering and deaths at the Iditarod. Please make this event a priority to show ExxonMobil that dogs are not ours to use and abuse for entertainment!
WHEN: Wednesday, October 7th, 11:45 am to 1 pm
WHERE: ExxonMobil 5124 SE 17th Ave. Portland, OR 97202 (Intersection of SE 17th and SE McLoughlin Blvd.)
CONTACT: Amber Canavan, AmberC@peta.org
Note: We will be taking precautions to ensure safe social distancing during this action. All activists are asked to maintain a distance of 6 ft. from each other and wear a protective face mask.
Posters will be provided. Note that reserved parking will not be available, and please be prepared for the weather. This event is accessible via public transportation by taking the MAX to the SE 17th Ave & Holgate Blvd MAX Station and walking south on SE 17th Ave. for approximately two blocks.
Dogs, just like those who may share our homes, deserve far better than a lifetime of isolation at the end of a chain, along with the cruelty and suffering that’s involved in training for and running in the Iditarod. Please make sure to come out to this event and please bring as many friends and family members as you can.
Learn more about the cruelty inherent in the Iditarod here: https://investigations.peta.org/iditarod-kennel-neglect/
Outreach events are a fun and effective way to help animals as well as meet local advocates, so before you go, check out PETA's outreach tips [http://www.mediapeta.com/.../PDF/tips_for_PETA_activists.pdf] and be sure to invite others. All materials will be provided, so please just bring along as many friends and family members as you can.
events.address: 5124 SE 17th Ave, Portland, OR 97202-4808, United States

events.title: Portland OR Fur Free Friday 2020
events.description:
Join us for the annual Fur Free Friday Rally the day after Thanksgiving in Downtown Portland! Everyone is welcome to this important event focused on encouraging retailers in adopting fur free policies and to urging lawmakers to pass a fur sale ban in Oregon.

Meet at Nordstrom Downtown at 12pm for a socially-distanced demonstration along the roadway where shoppers will likely be lining up to pick up online orders.

We ask that all attendees wear face masks and stand six feet apart from one another.

Banners, demo posters and leaflets will be provided, or make your own! If you make your own poster, please keep your messaging nonviolent/love-based.


California has banned the trapping of animals for fur and banned fur sales statewide. There are no fur shops in Portland anymore thanks to decades of activism. Fashion designers and apparel companies are adopting fur free policies left and right. The few retailers in Portland that still sell fur sell fur trimmed items and could easily transition away without hurting sales. Let's #MakeFurHistory in Oregon.

Dress code: Wear sensible and comfortable clothes and shoes and be prepared for the possibility of rain. This event goes on rain or shine.

Directions, Transit, and Parking:
There are bus, streetcar and MAX stops nearby. Plan your trip on trimet.org
There is on-street parking and several nearby parking garages https://www.portlandoregon.gov/transportation/article/254736
Safety:

Can I bring my family/kids/pre-vegans?
YES! Everyone is welcome as long as they are nonviolent and respectful.

Whether you can attend or not, you can take action for animals today and every day by calling the following stores in Portland that still sell fur:
Nordstrom (sells Canada Goose brand with coyote fur trim and fox fur trim coats): (888) 282-6060
Mario’s (sells Canada Goose brand with coyote fur trim): (503) 227-3477

events.title: Intersectional Veganism: A conversation about decolonizing health and healing justice
events.description:
In the third installment of our webinar series on Intersectional Veganism we are honored to welcome special guest Xavier Barraza, to share some of his expertise and experiences. We will learn about how plant-based eating has been an important aspect of Xavier's work in health and healing justice, and discuss decolonizing our diets.

This Intersectional Veganism Webinar Series aims to explore some of the ways that being vegan helps support other forms of activism, and why it is important for animal rights activists to actively support other social justice movements.

Register for the webinar here: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_4m4-RXnRSMy4_BZCzfr3aA

Xavier Barraza is a self-identified young man of color born in the South Valley of Albuquerque and stewarding a cattle ranch with his grandparents and family. He identities as multi-racial (Hopi, Mestizo, Chicanx, and German.) Xavier brings over 10 years of experiential knowledge in popular education, positive youth development and organizational development. As a young man of color he co-founded Together for Brothers (T4B), an organization building the capacity of young men of color to shape systems and self to work with and for them. In late·2018 he served as coordinator for the health and healing justice program forwarding a culture of decolonizing health and healing through self and collective care, restorative justice and plant-based eating. His passions include the imaginary, Degrowth, cognitive justice, democratic autonomy, social ecology, rock climbing, being in the sun, and engineering the self.

events.title: RAP SUMMIT | Evolving Beyond Animal Agriculture
events.description:
Want to end world hunger, pandemics, climate change, habitat destruction, wildlife extinction and preventable diseases? We can do it by evolving beyond animal agriculture. During this pandemic lots of farmers and ranchers have expressed interest in getting out of animal farming and into some other kind of farming or enterprise, while keeping their land and identity. This first of its kind virtual summit asks the question: how can farmers and ranchers thrive without using animals? YOU can ask questions. groups.description: "A group for vegan business owners to collaborate and promote their products and services. It will also be a forum for supporting one another with questions, feedback, or ideas. Additionally, we like to see all of your faces and value the power in connecting in-person, so there will be live networking/round table discussion opportunities too."

groups.name: Portland Vegan Straight-edge
groups.description: "This is a group for people to make friends, community, share, support, gather and have fun, who are also vegan and choose to do so without drink, smoke, or drugs. It is not about punk rock, but I couldn't think of a better name to describe the lifestyle. I encourage you to be proactive and post opportunities to meet with one another."

groups.name: Portland Metro Vegan Buy Nothing
groups.description: "Give Freely, Share Creatively. Post anything you'd like to give away, lend, or share among neighbors. Ask for anything you'd like to receive for free or borrow. Keep it legal. Keep it civil. No buying or selling. We're an adult-only, hyper-local gift economy. We are not a charity or community bulletin board."

groups.name: Vegan City Portland (OR)
groups.description: "This is a group for vegans in the Greater Portland Metro area and vicinity to meet, plan vegan events, share tips and enjoy community."

groups.name: Portland Vegans Debate Club
groups.description: "A place for discussion and debate. Some of the more contentious conversations might be directed here rather than happening on the main Portland Vegans page. It may also be a place to discuss issues more in depth than can happen on the faster moving forum. The same rules apply here as on Portland Vegans (see group expectations in Portland Vegans files) but there is more latitude in terms of topic and tone."

groups.name: /r/PortlandVegans
groups.description: "Home to vegans who live in or around Portland, vegans who want to visit Portland, or vegans and non-vegans who would like to learn more about what's happening in Portland."

groups.name: Vegans of Portland
groups.description: "This group is intended to serve the vegan community in Portland by providing a space for open, respectful discussion about all subjects that affect our lives, including but not limited to veganism and animal rights."

groups.name: Soyboys Vegan Men's Group
groups.description: "Soyboys is a local group of vegan gay men who host dine-outs and attend special events throughout the city. We love visiting the best vegan and veg-friendly spots around the city."

groups.name: Green Acres Farm Sanctuary
groups.description: "The mission of Green Acres Farm Sanctuary is the prevention of cruelty to, and the commercialization of animals, especially farmed animals. We put this mission into action by providing shelter, care and board to abused, abandoned, and unwanted farm animals. We look to inspire change through creating a place where members of the public can have positive interaction with farm animals by providing for their care and the animals can, in turn, educate them about the abusive use of farmed animals."
groups.address: 5272 Brush Creek Dr NE, Silverton, OR 97381

groups.name: Humane Voters Oregon
groups.description: "Humane Voters Oregon is a non-partisan organization that promotes humane treatment of animals through participation in Oregon’s political process."
groups.address: 5331 SW Macadam Ave., Suite 258 (PMB 624), Portland, OR 97202

groups.name: Lighthouse Farm Sanctuary
groups.description: "Lighthouse Farm Sanctuary is a 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to the rescue, rehabilitation and, when appropriate, rehoming of abused and neglected farmed animals."

groups.name: Northwest VEG
groups.description: "Northwest VEG is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization based in the Portland, OR and Vancouver, WA area. Founded in 2003, we are dedicated to bringing awareness to the power of a plant-based, vegan lifestyle and helping support people in their transition toward making healthier, more sustainable & compassionate food choices."

groups.name: Northwest Veg's Viva La Vegan - Portland Metro
groups.description: "This group seeks to bring together those interested in or currently living a compassionate vegan lifestyle for enjoyment and activities."

groups.name: NW Animal Foundation
groups.description: "The NW Animal Foundation, a recognized 501 (c)(3) based in Portland, Oregon, is an organization that raises funds to support animal rescues, sanctuaries and other organizations that address or prevent abuse."

groups.name: Odd Man Inn Animal Refuge
groups.description: "Odd Man Inn helps as many animals as possible find safety, rehabilitation, socialization and a forever home while giving them a voice as ambassadors for their own kind against imprisonment, abuse and consumption."

groups.name: Out To Pasture Sanctuary
groups.description: "Out to Pasture Sanctuary is a farmed animal sanctuary located in Estacada, Oregon. We provide a loving, permanent home to animals rescued from abuse, neglect, and slaughter, including farmed animals, animals rescued from scientific laboratories, and others."
groups.address: 33190 SE Regan Hill Rd, Estacada, OR 97023

groups.name: PDX VEG
groups.description: "PDX VEG seeks to empower people to shift towards a way of life that benefits humans, other animals, and our planet by providing three-week Veg Challenges that include cooking demos, a Vegan Mentor Program, practical tips, inspiration, and community, all free of charge."

groups.name: PEACE Portland
groups.description: "We are PEACE! We stand for the Promotion of Equality, Acceptance, and Compassion Everywhere (PEACE). We are a love-based group of humanitarians focused on liberating all beings from slavery, exploitation and cruelty."

groups.name: Portland Animal Save
groups.description: "Portland Animal Save bears witness to animals killed for food and clothing using a love-based community organizing approach."

groups.name: Portland Burrito Brigade
groups.description: "Burrito Brigade is a non-profit 501c(3) organization whose mission is to feed the hungry and unhoused in Oregon by hand-delivering vegan meals for free."

groups.name: Portland Metro Veggies
groups.description: "This Meetup is for vegans, vegetarians and the veg-curious. We come from all over the greater Portland metro area, East, West, North and South."

groups.name: AV: Portland, OR, USA
groups.description: "Anonymous for the Voiceless (AV) is an animal rights organization that specializes in educating the public on animal exploitation and fostering highly effective activism groups worldwide. We hold an abolitionist stance against animal exploitation and promote a clear vegan message."

groups.name: AV: Vancouver, WA, USA
groups.description: "Anonymous for the Voiceless (AV) is an animal rights organization that specializes in educating the public on animal exploitation and fostering highly effective activism groups worldwide. We hold an abolitionist stance against animal exploitation and promote a clear vegan message."

groups.name: Direct Action Everywhere - Portland
groups.description: "Direct Action Everywhere's mission is to empower activists to take strong and confident action wherever animals are being denigrated, enslaved, or killed, and create a world where animal liberation is a reality. We use creative nonviolent protest to tell the animals’ story."

groups.name: Advocates for Animal Welfare
groups.description: "We help connect people who want to get involved in, or learn more about, animal welfare issues. We welcome people from all places on the spectrum - from people who just really love dogs to people who believe in total liberation for animals."

groups.name: PAW Team
groups.description: "The Portland Animal Welfare (PAW) Team saves lives, alleviates suffering, and keeps pets and people together by providing free veterinary care to the pets of people who are experiencing homelessness or extreme poverty."

groups.name: The Raven Corps
groups.description: "The Raven Corps is a tax-exempt nonprofit organization, based out of Portland, Oregon. We support, organize, and mobilize young activists, aged 14 -22, who promote environmental sustainability and compassion through plant-based advocacy."

groups.name: Portland Animal Activism
groups.description: We are looking for people to unite with us for animal activism, outreach, volunteering and to help create awareness/get the message out on how/why to be a vegan and help animals.

resources.name: VegMovies
resources.author: Veg Groups
resources.description: "We are the largest directory of plant-based and animal-friendly movies. Find something to watch or recommend today."

resources.name: Earthlings
resources.author: Writer & Director: Shaun Monson
resources.description: "Using hidden cameras and never-before-seen footage, Earthlings chronicles the day-to-day practices of the largest industries in the world, all of which rely entirely on animals for profit."

resources.name: Dominion
resources.author: Writer & Director: Chris Delforce
resources.description: "Exposing the dark underbelly of modern animal agriculture through drones, hidden & handheld cameras, the feature-length film explores the morality and validity of our dominion over the animal kingdom. Now available to watch online for free."

resources.name: Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret
resources.author: Writer & Director: Kip Andersen, Keegan Kuhn
resources.description: "The World's largest environmental organizations are failing to address the single most destructive force facing the planet today. Follow the shocking, yet humorous, journey of an aspiring environmentalist, as he daringly seeks to find the real solution to the most pressing environmental issues and true path to sustainability."

resources.name: Forks Over Knives
resources.author: Writer & Director: Lee Fulkerson
resources.description: "Examines the profound claim that most, if not all, of the degenerative diseases that afflict us can be controlled, or even reversed, by rejecting our present menu of animal-based and processed foods."

resources.name: Truth or Drought
resources.description: "Truth or Drought is a science-based grassroots campaign making the undeniable connection between animal consumption and environmental breakdown."

resources.name: Vegan Cheat Sheet
resources.author: The Vegan Hacktivists
resources.description: A massive compilation of vegan resources.

resources.name: Vegan Starter Kit
resources.description: "Vegankit is an online all-in-one page for becoming and staying vegan"

resources.name: 101 Reasons to Go Vegan
resources.author: James Wildman of the Animal Rights Foundation of Florida (http://arff.org)
resources.description: "A fascinating and entertaining presentation on the ethical solutions and health benefits of veganism by James Wildman of the Animal Rights Foundation of Florida"

resources.name: 5 Minutes 5 Vegans
resources.author: The Vegan Hacktivists
resources.description: "In just 5 minutes or less you can help 5 or more people become Vegan right now - it's fast, simple, and free!"

resources.name: A Prayer for Compassion
resources.description: "A Prayer for Compassion is a feature length documentary that strives to inspire and encourage those already on a religious or spiritual path, to expand their circle of compassion to embrace all life, regardless of species, and make choices in alignment with this value."

resources.name: Animal Clock
resources.description: "Animal Clock was created to bring attention to the incredible number of animals currently suffering on factory farms."

resources.name: Called to Rescue
resources.description: "A beautiful and inspiring glimpse into the unbridled compassion on fifteen farm animal sanctuaries throughout the US. The rescued farm animals, simply by being who they are, are changing lives, lifestyles, and beliefs on both sides of the fence. The humans, many of whom dramatically altered the course of their lives because of a connection with a farm animal, are dedicated beyond words."

resources.name: Challenge 22
resources.description: "Are you ready for the challenge? Join thousands of participants for a 22-day vegan experience. You'll receive fabulous recipes and personal guidance from our mentors and clinical dietitians."

resources.name: ChooseVeg
resources.description: A website with helpful information on plant-based eating.

resources.name: Counting Animals
resources.author: Harish
resources.description: "It is a blog that aims to collect, generate, analyze, organize, present and interpret quantitative information related to the animal advocacy movement. Occasionally, it will employ tools and insights from computer science and mathematics to discover facts pertinent to the animal advocacy movement. From time to time, it may also make number-related nerdy observations of no use to anybody."

resources.name: Food Monster
resources.description: (iOS only) "One Green Planet's Food Monster app gives you instant access to vegan, meatless and dairy-free recipes that are sure to satisfy all taste buds! By SUBSCRIBING to our PAID monthly and yearly subscription options you can get access to 10+ new recipes DAILY (that’s an additional 3,000 new recipes every year!) but you can also unlock our archive of over 8,000 recipes searchable via 600+ category filters!"

resources.name: FoodPrint
resources.description: "FoodPrint will help you make food choices that do less harm to the environment, animals and people."

resources.name: Go Vegan World
resources.description: "Go Vegan World exists to educate the public on animal rights, to promote veganism, to dispel the myths that sustain animal exploitation, and to dismantle the legal property status of other animals."

resources.name: How Not to Die
resources.author: Michael Greger, M.D.
resources.description: "From the physician behind the trusted website NutritionFacts.org, How Not to Die reveals the groundbreaking scientific evidence behind the only diet that can prevent and reverse many of the causes of premature death and disability"

resources.name: List of Vegans - Wikipedia
resources.author: Various
resources.description: A list of noteworthy vegans throughout history.

resources.name: Live Kindly
resources.description: "Inspired by the notion that Mother Nature's intricate design is arguably flawless, the LK community have come together to build a home for informative and thought-provoking content, focusing on sustainable and compassionate living."

resources.name: New Vegan Support
resources.description: a facebook group providing support for new vegans.

resources.name: NutritionFacts.org
resources.description: information about nutrition and health

resources.name: One Green Planet
resources.description: "One Green Planet is a platform for the growing compassionate and eco-conscious generation. Our goal is to help create a world where we eat delicious food and use amazing products that provide us with maximum benefit and have minimum impact on the planet."

resources.name: Peaceable Kingdom: The Journey Home
resources.author: Tribe of Heart
resources.description: "A riveting story of transformation and healing, PEACEABLE KINGDOM: THE JOURNEY HOME explores the awakening conscience of several people who grew up in traditional farming culture and who have now come to question the basic assumptions of their way of life."

resources.name: Plant-Based News
resources.description: "Plant Based News is a multi-award-winning resource for the latest up-to-the-minute plant-based-interest content. It is stuffed with vegan news, blogs, reviews, and much more. Our aim is to raise awareness about the climate crisis, environmentalism, animal rights, ethical consumerism and healthy plant-based living. Not a false narrative - but information that empowers people to make better choices."

resources.name: Shrink That Footprint
resources.description: A blog and video series about climate change and ways to reduce your carbon footprint

resources.name: Slaughterhouse
resources.author: Tras los Muros
resources.description: "Over the course of a number of months, between the years 2015 and 2017 I gained access to 58 slaughterhouses, located ten different Mexican states. During this time, I documented the killing of cows, goats, chickens and horses, as well as the transport of these animals, from farm to slaughterhouse."

resources.name: The Best Speech You Will Ever Hear
resources.author: Gary Yourofsky

resources.name: The China Study
resources.author: T. Colin Campbell, Ph.D. and Thomas M. Campbell II, M.D.

resources.name: The Vegan Rainbow Project
resources.description: "With this blog we want to explore interconnections of oppression and enhance visibility for vegan living minorities and marginalised groups, whilst at the same time joining forces to work towards liberation for all beings."

resources.name: The World Peace Diet
resources.author: Dr. Will Tuttle PhD
resources.description: "The World Peace Diet, now translated and published worldwide in 16 languages, connects many dotsâ€”culturally, historically, nutritionally, ecologically, psychologically, and spirituallyâ€”to reveal how our routine exploitation of animals for food and other products boomerangs in countless ways, affecting both our outer world and the inner landscape of our daily experience."

resources.name: This Speech Is Your Wake Up Call
resources.author: James Aspey

resources.name: VeGuide
resources.author: The Vegan Society
resources.description: A free app to help people go vegan.

resources.name: What the Health
resources.description: "What the Health is the groundbreaking follow-up film from the creators of the award-winning documentary Cowspiracy. The film exposes the collusion and corruption in government and big business that is costing us trillions of healthcare dollars, and keeping us sick."

resources.name: You Are Their Voice
resources.description: "Vegan Developers & Designers Activists volunteering our time towards Vegan projects worth supporting 🐷"

resources.name: You Will Never Look at Your Life in the Same Way Again
resources.author: Earthling Ed
resources.description: "Watch the eye-opening speech that was given to thousands of students in universities across the UK."

resources.name: Vegan Health
resources.description:
VeganHealth.org provides:
- Reviews of the scientific literature related to the health benefits of a vegan diet.
- Discussions about concerns related to vegan nutrition.
- Recommendations for nutrients that can be low in the diets of some vegans.

resources.name: Double Check Vegan
resources.description: Check whether ingredients are vegan or not.

resources.name: Vegan Playlist
resources.description: "Find and share inspirational Vegan videos. Spread the compassionate Vegan message with our curated playlists, or create your own from our huge video library."

resources.name: The Animal People
resources.author: Executive Produced by Joaquin Phoenix
resources.description: "More than ten years in the making, the feature documentary THE ANIMAL PEOPLE, from directors Cassandra Suchan and Denis Henry Hennelly, follows the journey of six young activists who find themselves indicted as terrorists by the United States government. The reason for indictment: the activists' leadership of a controversial open protest campaign aiming to close down the largest animal testing laboratory in the world."

resources.name: Animal Liberation
resources.author: Peter Singer
resources.description: "Since its original publication in 1975, this groundbreaking work has awakened millions of concerned men and women to the shocking abuse of animals everywhere -- inspiring a worldwide movement to eliminate much of the cruel and unnecessary laboratory animal experimentation of years past."

resources.name: Why We Love Dogs, Eat Pigs, and Wear Cows: An Introduction to Carnism
resources.author: Melanie Joy

resources.name: Vystopia: The Anguish of Being Vegan in a Non-vegan World
resources.author: Clare Mann

resources.name: Barnivore
resources.description: "Is your booze vegan? It might seem weird at first, but your favourite drink might have more than just alcohol in it. The Barnivore Vegan Alcohol Directory is here to help."

resources.name: Animal Activist Support Line
resources.author: In Defense of Animals
resources.description: "We can provide you with free and confidential support on any aspect of your animal advocacy. We hope to hear from you soon!"

chants.text: Compassion is the fashion / Don't wear fur
Compassion is unstoppable / Another world is possible
Animal liberation now / Animal liberation now
Do not buy the humane lie / Animals do not want to die
One struggle, one fight / human freedom, animal rights!

responses.title: It's my personal choice to eat animals
responses.response: Whether a choice is personal depends on whether there's a victim. You are not allowed to drink and drive because it puts other lives at risk. Our laws and sense of morality are governed by how our actions effect others. Animals have pain.

Animal agriculture produces 37% of greenhouse gas emissions
